alert.note: Alert for Northern Humboldt Coast; Northern Humboldt Interior; Northern Trinity; Southern Humboldt Interior (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 06 at 9:48AM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT CENTRAL HUMBOLDT AND NORTHWESTERN TRINITY COUNTIES THROUGH 1045 AM PST... At 948 AM PST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Arcata, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Eureka, Arcata, Willow Creek, McKinleyville, Blue Lake, Myrtletown, Cutten, Fieldbrook, Bayview, Samoa, Humboldt Hill, and Pine Hills. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Northern Humboldt Coast; Northern Humboldt Interior; Northern Trinity; Southern Humboldt Interior
